feature.name: AppDomains
feature.description: AppDomains are unsupported on .NET Core. For isolation purposes we recommend to use the new AssemblyLoadContext API.

member.name: CreateInstance(AppDomain, String, String, Boolean, BindingFlags, Binder, Object[], CultureInfo, Object[])
CreateInstance(AppDomain, String, String, Boolean, BindingFlags, Binder, Object[], CultureInfo, Object[], Evidence)
CreateInstanceFrom(AppDomain, String, String, Boolean, BindingFlags, Binder, Object[], CultureInfo, Object[], Evidence)
CreateInstanceFrom(AppDomain, String, String, Boolean, BindingFlags, Binder, Object[], CultureInfo, Object[])

feature.name: Code Access Security (CAS)
feature.description: Code Access Security (CAS) is not supported on .NET Core.

member.name: CreateInstance(String, String, Boolean, BindingFlags, Binder, Object[], CultureInfo, Object[], Evidence)
CreateInstanceFrom(String, String, Boolean, BindingFlags, Binder, Object[], CultureInfo, Object[], Evidence)
SecurityException(String, AssemblyName, PermissionSet, PermissionSet, MethodInfo, SecurityAction, Object, IPermission, Evidence)
SecurityException(String, Object, Object, MethodInfo, Object, IPermission)
XmlSerializer(Type, XmlAttributeOverrides, Type[], XmlRootAttribute, String, String, Evidence)
CreateSerializer(Type, XmlAttributeOverrides, Type[], XmlRootAttribute, String, String, Evidence)

feature.name: Remoting
feature.description: Remoting is not supported on .NET Core. You should look into other means of communication, such as named pipes, GRPC, or REST.

feature.name: Native params (__arglist)
feature.description: This feature was provided for advanced C++/CLI features which are no longer needed. You should call one of the overloads that don't use __arglist.

feature.name: Windows Access Control Lists (ACLs)
feature.description: While .NET Core does support Windows Access Control Lists (ACLs), some of the functionality has moved to extension methods while some of the static methods and constructors have moved to different types.

member.name: FileStream(String, FileMode, FileSystemRights, FileShare, Int32, FileOptions)
FileStream(String, FileMode, FileSystemRights, FileShare, Int32, FileOptions, FileSecurity)
CreateFromFile(FileStream, String, Int64, MemoryMappedFileAccess, MemoryMappedFileSecurity, HandleInheritability, Boolean)
CreateNew(String, Int64, MemoryMappedFileAccess, MemoryMappedFileOptions, MemoryMappedFileSecurity, HandleInheritability)
CreateOrOpen(String, Int64, MemoryMappedFileAccess, MemoryMappedFileOptions, MemoryMappedFileSecurity, HandleInheritability)
NamedPipeClientStream(String, String, PipeAccessRights, PipeOptions, TokenImpersonationLevel, HandleInheritability)
NamedPipeServerStream(String, PipeDirection, Int32, PipeTransmissionMode, PipeOptions, Int32, Int32, PipeSecurity)
NamedPipeServerStream(String, PipeDirection, Int32, PipeTransmissionMode, PipeOptions, Int32, Int32, PipeSecurity, HandleInheritability)
NamedPipeServerStream(String, PipeDirection, Int32, PipeTransmissionMode, PipeOptions, Int32, Int32, PipeSecurity, HandleInheritability, PipeAccessRights)

feature.name: Microsoft.Build (MSBuild)
feature.description: Microsoft.Build (MSBuild) is only partially availabe for .NET Core.

feature.name: Microsoft.JScript
feature.description: JScript was a managed implementation of Java Script, which is far behind current versions and thus considered obsolete. There is no built-in alternative, but you could look into hosting V8. Alternatively, if you use Blazor you can also call into the the browser's JavaScript engine.

feature.name: Microsoft.SqlServer.Server
feature.description: SQL CLR (i.e. the ability to host .NET code inside of a SQL Server) is not available on .NET Core.

feature.name: Microsoft.VisualBasic
feature.description: Microsoft.VisualBasic is only partially available for .NET Core.

feature.name: Microsoft.VisualC
feature.description: Microsoft.VisualC is not available for .NET Core.

feature.name: System.AddIn (Managed Add-in Framework, MAF)
feature.description: The Managed Add-in Framework (MAF) is unsupported on .NET Core and has no replacement.

feature.name: System.Configuration Installation
feature.description: System.Configuration but the installer component isn't available for .NET Core. You should use an installer of your choice, for example Windows Installer XML (WIX) or InstallShield.

feature.name: System.Configuration Handlers
feature.description: While System.Configuration is available for .NET Core it's considered a legacy API. You can no longer use it to configure the platform itself, which is why all strongly typed app.config section handlers are not available for .NET Core.

feature.name: System.Data.Entity (EF 4)
feature.description: System.Data.Entity (EF v4) is not supported on .NET Core. Use EFCore or EF6.

feature.name: System.Data.Linq (DLinq)
feature.description: System.Data.Linq (DLinq) is not supported on .NET Core. Use EFCore instead.

feature.name: System.Data.OracleClient
feature.description: System.Data.OracleClient is obsolete and not available for .NET Core. Use the implementation provided by Oracle instead (https://www.nuget.org/profiles/Oracle).

feature.name: System.Data.Services (WCF Data Services)
feature.description: System.Data.Services (WCF Data Services) is not supported on .NET Core.

feature.name: System.Data.SqlClient Column Encryption
feature.description: SQL Client's column encryption isn't available in .NET Core.

feature.name: System.Deployment (ClickOnce)
feature.description: ClickOnce is not available on .NET Core

feature.name: System.Device.Location
feature.description: System.Device.Location is not supported on .NET Core.

feature.name: System.Diagnostics.SymbolStore COM-based reader/writer
feature.description: The COM-based symbol store reader/writer isn't available on .NET Core.

feature.name: System.DirectoryServices
feature.description: System.DirectoryServices is only partially available for .NET Core.

feature.name: System.EnterpriseServices
feature.description: System.EnterpriseServices are not available for .NET Core.

feature.name: System.Globalization Culture Builder
feature.description: System.Globalization's Culture Builder is not available on .NET Core.

feature.name: System.IdentityModel (Windows Identity Foundation, WIF)
feature.description: Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) is only partially provided on .NET Core, as part of Windows Communication Foundation (WCF).

feature.name: System.IO.Log
feature.description: System.IO.Log is not supported on .NET Core.

feature.name: System.Net.Http WebRequestHandler
feature.description: WebRequestHandler is not supported on .NET Core.

feature.name: System.Net.PeerToPeer
feature.description: System.Net.PeerToPeer is not supported on .NET Core.

feature.name: System.Management.Instrumentation
feature.description: System.Management.Instrumentation is not available on .NET Core.

feature.name: System.Messaging (MSMQ)
feature.description: System.Messaging (MSMQ) is not supported on .NET Core.

feature.name: System.Reflection.Emit Persistence
feature.description: .NET Core doesn't support using System.Reflection.Emit to create assemblies on disk. If you need to generate code that can be loaded later, you should use a compiler, such as Roslyn.

feature.name: System.Reflection.Emit Strongly-Typed tokens
feature.description: Strongly typed tokens in reflection emit APIs aren't supported on .NET Core.

feature.name: System.Runtime.Caching SQL Monitoring
feature.description: SQL monitoring in System.Runtime.Caching isn't available on .NET Core.

feature.name: System.Runtime.InteropServices.WindowsRuntime (WinRT) Legacy APIs
feature.description: The Windows Runtime (WinRT) support has been moved to a code generator, called CsWinRT.

feature.name: System.Runtime.InteropServices Legacy Helpers
feature.description: Some types in System.Runtime.InteropServices that only carry shape information are not available in .NET Core. If you need them, you can copy and paste the type from the .NET Framework reference source.

feature.name: System.Runtime.InteropServices.CustomMarshalers
feature.description: CustomMarshallers isn't available on .NET Core.

feature.name: System.Runtime.DurableInstancing
feature.description: System.Runtime.DurableInstancing isn't available on .NET Core.

feature.name: System.Runtime.Serialization.IDataContractSurrogate
feature.description: System.Runtime.Serialization.IDataContractSurrogate is not available on .NET Core. The replacement is ISerializationSurrogateProvider2.

member.name: DataContractSerializer(Type, IEnumerable<Type>, Int32, Boolean, Boolean, IDataContractSurrogate)
DataContractSerializer(Type, IEnumerable<Type>, Int32, Boolean, Boolean, IDataContractSurrogate, DataContractResolver)
DataContractSerializer(Type, String, String, IEnumerable<Type>, Int32, Boolean, Boolean, IDataContractSurrogate)
DataContractSerializer(Type, String, String, IEnumerable<Type>, Int32, Boolean, Boolean, IDataContractSurrogate, DataContractResolver)
DataContractSerializer(Type, XmlDictionaryString, XmlDictionaryString, IEnumerable<Type>, Int32, Boolean, Boolean, IDataContractSurrogate)
DataContractSerializer(Type, XmlDictionaryString, XmlDictionaryString, IEnumerable<Type>, Int32, Boolean, Boolean, IDataContractSurrogate, DataContractResolver)
DataContractJsonSerializer(Type, IEnumerable<Type>, Int32, Boolean, IDataContractSurrogate, Boolean)
DataContractJsonSerializer(Type, String, IEnumerable<Type>, Int32, Boolean, IDataContractSurrogate, Boolean)
DataContractJsonSerializer(Type, XmlDictionaryString, IEnumerable<Type>, Int32, Boolean, IDataContractSurrogate, Boolean)

feature.name: System.Security.Principal Unsafe Windows Impersonation APIs
feature.description: We didn't bring unsafe impersonation APIs to .NET Core. Instead, use WindowsIdentity.RunImpersonated() or WindowsIdentity.RunImpersonatedAsync().

feature.name: System.ServiceModel (Windows Communication Foundation, WCF)
feature.description: Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) is only partially provided on .NET Core.

feature.name: System.ServiceProcess Installation
feature.description: System.ServiceProcess is available such that you can author and interact with Windows services but the installer component isn't available for .NET Core. You should use an installer of your choice, for example Windows Installer XML (WIX) or InstallShield.

feature.name: System.Threading.Interlocked.SpeculationBarrier()
feature.description: This is a .NET Framework only concept that doesn't apply to .NET Core. Simply remove the usage from your code.

feature.name: System.Windows.Forms Legacy Controls
feature.description: System.Windows.Forms (WinForms) is available on .NET Core, but some controls are no longer available.

feature.name: System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization
feature.description: While System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization is available to .NET Core via a NuGet package, it's marked as preview and is unsupported. You should replace it with a third party control library.

feature.name: System.Windows.Forms Designer (WinForms Designer)
feature.description: In .NET Core, System.Design (WinForms Designer) is part of Visual Studio.

feature.name: System.Web
feature.description:
System.Web has been replaced by ASP.NET Core.
You can fix many of the differences by adding a reference to System.Web.Adapters. If you are using .NET Upgrade Assistant to upgrade your project, this will be done automatically.

feature.name: System.Workflow (Windows Workflow Foundation, WF)
feature.description: The Windows Workflow Foundation (WF) is unsupported on .NET Core. UiPath have used the .NET Framework reference source to provide an implementation for .NET Core, which you can find in their GitHub organization at https://github.com/UiPath/corewf.

feature.name: System.Xml.Xsl.Runtime (SqlXml)
feature.description: System.Xml.Xsl.Runtime (SqlXml) is not supported on .NET Core.
